content:
• Wednesday, July 27, 2011
  • LSI-OLD

    More on LSI-OLD: Guides for Q3 revenue of $535M-$565M (10% Q/Q growth at midpoint), beating...

    More on LSI-OLD: Guides for Q3 revenue of $535M-$565M (10% Q/Q growth at midpoint), beating consensus of $510.7M. Guides for Q3 non-GAAP EPS of $0.11-$0.17, midpoint of range above $0.12 consensus. Company has repurchased 56M shares YTD. LSI +8.7% AH. (Q2 results) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • CROX

    More on Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Guides for Q3 revenue and EPS of $280M and $0.40, above $264.2M and...

    More on Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Guides for Q3 revenue and EPS of $280M and $0.40, above $264.2M and $0.32 consensus. Q2 sales up 37.5% Y/Y in Asia; 50.4% in Europe; 15.9% in Americas. Asia and Europe account for 59% of revenue. SG&A expenses decline to 36.4% of revenue, from 41.2% in Q2 2010. CROX +10.2% AH. (Q2 results) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • QRVO

    More on TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): Q2 EPS in-line, but misses on revenues as margins were...

    More on TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): Q2 EPS in-line, but misses on revenues as margins were hit by a 20% jump in operating expenses. The company guides lower for Q3, saying bookings are just 88% to the midpoint of revenue guidance. Shares -14% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • GMCR

    More on Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 guidance of 100-105% revenue growth and...

    More on Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 guidance of 100-105% revenue growth and non-GAAP EPS of $0.44-$0.48 above consensus of 88% growth and $0.43 EPS. FY12 guidance of 60-65% revenue growth and $2.55-$2.65 non-GAAP EPS above consensus of 41% growth and $2.15 EPS. GMCR +18% AH. (FQ3 results) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $228.8M (+10%) misses by $8M....

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $228.8M (+10%) misses by $8M. Shares -14% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTXS

    More on Citrix's (NASDAQ:CTXS) Q2: FQ3 revenue guidance of $540M-$547M in line with $542.8M...

    More on Citrix's (NASDAQ:CTXS) Q2: FQ3 revenue guidance of $540M-$547M in line with $542.8M consensus. FQ3 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $0.56-$0.58 below $0.61 consensus. FY11 revenue guidance of $2.16B-$2.19B above $2.16B consensus. FY11 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $2.38-$2.41 below $2.42 consensus. CTXS -6.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • SYMC

    More on Symantec's (NASDAQ:SYMC) FQ1: Deferred revenue as of 7/1 was $3.69B, up 23% Y/Y....

    More on Symantec's (NASDAQ:SYMC) FQ1: Deferred revenue as of 7/1 was $3.69B, up 23% Y/Y. Consumer division up 11% Y/Y; Security and Compliance up 31%; Storage and Server Management up 14%; Services down 20% due to shift to "partner-led consulting model." Operating cash flow up 50% Y/Y to $503M. SYMC +2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SYMC

    Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC): FQ1 non-GAAP EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.65B (+15% Y/Y)...

    Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC): FQ1 non-GAAP EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.65B (+15% Y/Y) beats by $60M. FQ2 revenue guidance of $1.655B-$1.675B above $1.62B consensus. FQ2 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $0.38-$0.39, roughly in line with $0.38 consensus. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • CCMP

    Semiconductor equipment manufacturer Cabot Microelectronics (NASDAQ:CCMP) is down 9% after...

    Semiconductor equipment manufacturer Cabot Microelectronics (NASDAQ:CCMP) is down 9% after reporting FQ3 revenue and EPS of $111.8M (+10% Y/Y) and $0.54, below a consensus of $114.5M and $0.68. Gross margin fell to 47.4% from 49.1% in the year-ago period, which the company attributes to forex issues and price cuts. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL -5.2%) slides after announcing the launch of AOL HD, an app that will deliver...

    AOL (AOL -5.2%) slides after announcing the launch of AOL HD, an app that will deliver high-definition video to users connected to certain TV platforms. Investors appear skeptical the app will bring success, and shares hit a 52-week low, underscoring Wall Street's suspicion that its February alliance with Huffington Post "has proven to be anything but a godsend."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • RAMP

    Acxiom (ACXM +17.8%) reported an in-line FQ1 with slightly better revenues earlier today, but...

    Acxiom (ACXM +17.8%) reported an in-line FQ1 with slightly better revenues earlier today, but the stock is soaring as investors applaud the appointment of former Microsoft (MSFT -2.8%) executive Scott Howe as its new CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX -6.3%) shares slide for a second day after the company's reported Q2 loss, and...

    Patriot Coal (PCX -6.3%) shares slide for a second day after the company's reported Q2 loss, and Goldman Sachs cuts its rating on the stock and removes it from the firm's Convicton Buy list. Higher production costs were above expectations, leading Goldman to decide "PCX no longer screens as attractively vs. peers."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • ACCO

    Office supplies manufacturer ACCO Brands (ABD +14.2%) soars after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS...

    Office supplies manufacturer ACCO Brands (ABD +14.2%) soars after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $330.2M (+8% Y/Y) and $0.15, beating a consensus of $325.1M and $0.09. The company is reiterating its 2011 revenue growth guidance of 2-4%, but now forecasts EPS growth to be at the high end of a prior 20-30% guidance range. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ATI

    More on Allegheny Technologies (ATI -4.2%): Q2 earnings jumped 76% on higher sales of...

    More on Allegheny Technologies (ATI -4.2%): Q2 earnings jumped 76% on higher sales of flat-rolled products, but EPS fell short as higher material costs and acquisition expenses negatively impacted bottom-line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • TPX

    More on Tempur-Pedic (TPX +10%): shares soar after the company reports Q2 profit jumped 58%, as...

    More on Tempur-Pedic (TPX +10%): shares soar after the company reports Q2 profit jumped 58%, as strong mattress sales and improvements to manufacturing operations boosted margins. The company also raises its FY guidance for the second time.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • UAL

    Frustrated over contract negotiation delays, United Continental (UAL -2.8%) pilots are rumored...

    Frustrated over contract negotiation delays, United Continental (UAL -2.8%) pilots are rumored to have staged a "sick-out," causing the cancellation of 24 Continental flights out of Newark due to a lack of pilots. The airline is embroiled in contentious negotiations with its union over a new joint contract.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) soars 23.9% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $46M...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) soars 23.9% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $46M (+62% Y/Y) and $0.23, beating a consensus of $41.8M and $0.20. The company shipped 2,430 vials of its Acthar drug for treating multiple sclerosis, nephrotic syndrome, and infantile spasms, up 45% Y/Y. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • JNY

    Apparel maker The Jones Group (NYSE:JNY) is up 18% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS...

    Apparel maker The Jones Group (NYSE:JNY) is up 18% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $887.4M (+3.2% Y/Y) and $0.33 - the former fell $7.4M short of consensus, but the latter beat by by $0.06. CEO John T. McClain says the company is "cautiously optimistic" about the second-half retail environment. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSS

    Total System Services (TSS +5.7%) stands atop the S&P leader board after posting an 8.1%...

    Total System Services (TSS +5.7%) stands atop the S&P leader board after posting an 8.1% jump in Q2 profit and scoring a double-digit percentage revenue increase for international services, which offset a decline in revenue from North American and merchant services. Barclays upgrades shares and raises its price target to $23 from $17.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • KEM

    Capacitor manufacturer KEMET (NYSE:KEM) is up 11.2% after reporting FQ1 revenue and non-GAAP EPS...

    Capacitor manufacturer KEMET (NYSE:KEM) is up 11.2% after reporting FQ1 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $289.9M (+19% Y/Y) and $0.71, beating a consensus of $277.1M and $0.54. In spite of soaring prices for tantalum and other needed materials, KEMET's gross margin grew slightly over the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNPR

    Network processor developers are falling hard in the wake of Juniper's (JNPR -20.1%) Q2 results....

    Network processor developers are falling hard in the wake of Juniper's (JNPR -20.1%) Q2 results. EZCH -6.1%. CAVM -9.6%. [NETL]] -7.8%. AMCC -5.5%. Networking equipment vendors are also underperforming the NASDAQ. CSCO -3.2%. FFIV -3.5%. [RVBD]] -5.2%. APKT -4%. ARUN -8.5%. ALLT -4.9%. CIEN -9.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • EBAY

    After earlier hijacking attempts failed, hacker groups Lulz Security and Anonymous are now...

    After earlier hijacking attempts failed, hacker groups Lulz Security and Anonymous are now calling for a boycott of Ebay's (EBAY -2%) PayPal, saying they aim to punish the company for withholding WikiLeaks donations. So far, the group says more than 35,000 users have closed their accounts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • WBSN

    Websense (WBSN -12.4%) dips after its Q2 fell short of estimates. The Internet-security company...

    Websense (WBSN -12.4%) dips after its Q2 fell short of estimates. The Internet-security company says most of its sales territories posted strong incremental billings growth, but it continues to experience weak sales in continental Europe due to its own poor execution.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRN

    Trinity Industries (TRN -9.7%) takes a hit after slightly missing Q2 consensus estimates and...

    Trinity Industries (TRN -9.7%) takes a hit after slightly missing Q2 consensus estimates and lowering its guidance for the year. It said FY results will be impacted by product-mix changes in its wind-towers business, and the rate of recovery from flooding at its Missouri barge facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • CVGI

    Commercial Vehicle Group (CVGI -18%) gets hammered after missing its revenue estimates and...

    Commercial Vehicle Group (CVGI -18%) gets hammered after missing its revenue estimates and reporting a Q2 loss on impairment and restructuring charges. Separately, the company announces it's acquired the assets of Stratos Seating for $2.3M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • AUO

    LCD panel maker AU Optronics (NYSE:AUO) is down 4.5% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of...

    LCD panel maker AU Optronics (NYSE:AUO) is down 4.5% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $3.41B and -$0.42, below a consensus of $3.5B and -$0.31.The company also cut its 2011 capex forecast by 30% (a negative for AMAT), and forecast "low single digit" sequential panel shipment growth. Last week, rival LG Display (NYSE:LPL) also gave subdued guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • MCO

    After initially moving higher following the company's Q2 earnings beat and FY11 guidance hike,...

    After initially moving higher following the company's Q2 earnings beat and FY11 guidance hike, Moody's (MCO -4.3%) shares have reversed course. Moody's and S&P execs are due to testify before Congress regarding attempts to reform the credit ratings industry, and the companies' role in the debt ceiling debate.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • NCI

    Navigant Consulting (NYSE:NCI) is up 7% after reporting revenue and adjusted EPS of $194.4M...

    Navigant Consulting (NYSE:NCI) is up 7% after reporting revenue and adjusted EPS of $194.4M (+13% Y/Y) and $0.21, ahead of a consensus of $185M and $0.18. The company expects 2011 revenue and EPS to be at the high end of prior guidance ranges of $715M-$760M and $0.70-$0.77, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • DNKN

    Dunkin Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) opens for trading at $25, up 31% from its $19 IPO listing price.

    Dunkin Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) opens for trading at $25, up 31% from its $19 IPO listing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • AVL

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -9.2%) prices its 7.1M secondary offering at $6.15 per share, a 9.6%...

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -9.2%) prices its 7.1M secondary offering at $6.15 per share, a 9.6% discount to yesterdays close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • SSYS

    3D printing system maker Stratasys (SSYS -21.2%) craters after releasing Q2 results. While...

    3D printing system maker Stratasys (SSYS -21.2%) craters after releasing Q2 results. While non-GAAP EPS of $0.23 beat consensus by a penny, revenue of $37.6M (+25% Y/Y) fell short by $1.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) falls 4.8% as UBS cuts its PT on the company to $30 from $41. In...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) falls 4.8% as UBS cuts its PT on the company to $30 from $41. In addition to sounding traditional alarm bells, UBS is concerned RIM's position is weakening in mature international markets, and doesn't believe the company will get far in China, where Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) have already made strong inroads.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • TUP

    Tupperware (TUP -9%) slides despite beating earnings expectations and raising its FY11 outlook....

    Tupperware (TUP -9%) slides despite beating earnings expectations and raising its FY11 outlook. Up more than 40% YTD prior to the release, the shares were likely due for a bit of selling.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • ARW

    More on Arrow Electronics (ARW -6.4%): shares dip after posting a weaker Q2 top-line due to...

    More on Arrow Electronics (ARW -6.4%): shares dip after posting a weaker Q2 top-line due to slower sales. The company also reduces its FY forecast, reflecting an oversupply of inventory at the end of the quarter and weaker global macroeconomic conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • AMZN

    Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt thinks Amazon's (AMZN +5.7%) surging revenues put it right around...

    Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt thinks Amazon's (AMZN +5.7%) surging revenues put it right around where Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) was in 1991. Only he thinks Amazon's story is better, due to the company's business model "allowing it to participate in a transition of physical to digital retail" that can produce "higher long-term economic returns."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • PFCB

    P.F. Chang's (PFCB -10%) slumps after Q2 earnings dropped 29% as the restaurant operator gets...

    P.F. Chang's (PFCB -10%) slumps after Q2 earnings dropped 29% as the restaurant operator gets hit by a decline in guest traffic. The company slashes its full-year guidance as same-store sales continue to fall off, and announces plans to test more lower-priced items in hopes of bringing customers back.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • GLBC

    Global Crossing (NASDAQ:GLBC) drops 4.2% after reporting Q2 EPS of -$0.57, above the -$0.62...

    Global Crossing (NASDAQ:GLBC) drops 4.2% after reporting Q2 EPS of -$0.57, above the -$0.62 consensus. Revenue of $692M (+10% Y/Y) is above the $673M consensus, and free cash flow of $10M is up from -$93M in Q1. Company guides for 2011 "invest and grow" revenue growth of 6-9%. Consensus is for 4.8% total revenue growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • ANTM

    More on Wellpoint (WLP): Q2 beats estimates on strong revenues, but the bottom-line was hit by...

    More on Wellpoint (WLP): Q2 beats estimates on strong revenues, but the bottom-line was hit by expenses as the company used a larger portion of premiums to cover senior medical costs. The company sees its senior business continuing to negatively impact margins for the remainder of the year, and lowers its FY forecast. Shares -3.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • GLW

    More on Corning (NYSE:GLW): Q2 earnings drop as lower TV sales and higher expenses neutralized...

    More on Corning (NYSE:GLW): Q2 earnings drop as lower TV sales and higher expenses neutralized revenue growth in its specialty materials unit. The company lowers its FY LCD glass sales estimates, the bulk of its profits, from $3.5B - $3.7B to $3.3B - $3.4B as consumers scale back on TV purchases due to a weak economy. Shares -4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Analysts are lifting their targets for Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) following its Q2 beat and strong Q3...

    Analysts are lifting their targets for Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) following its Q2 beat and strong Q3 guidance. Citi notes Q2 featured Amazon's fastest growth in a decade, and argues the company's operating margin only fell due to R&D and Fulfillment spending that's "creating even deeper moats." AMZN +5.1% premarket, putting its market cap above $100B for the first time. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Shelly Adelson "manages investor expectations" on yesterday's...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) CEO Shelly Adelson "manages investor expectations" on yesterday's call, calling Marina Bay Sands, "the most successful integrated resort in the history of the hospitality, gaming & entertainment industry." The property booked a "whopping" $405M in Ebitda and an Ebitda margin of 55% (!). Shares +5.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • AVL

    Avalon (NYSEMKT:AVL) gives back all of yesterday's moonshot after the rare earth miner files to...

    Avalon (NYSEMKT:AVL) gives back all of yesterday's moonshot after the rare earth miner files to raise about $45M in a secondary offering. As opposed to just insiders looking to cash out, the proceeds are to be used for business purposes. Shares -6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • MNK

    Premarket gainers: QCOR +14%. KEM +10%. NJ +10%. RFMD +6%. LVS +5%. AMZN +5%. AET +4%. BA...

    Premarket gainers: QCOR +14%. KEM +10%. NJ +10%. RFMD +6%. LVS +5%. AMZN +5%. AET +4%. BA +3%.
    Losers: JNPR -20%. PFCB -11%. ILMN -9%. ALU -7%. AVL -6%. CIEN -6%. LVLT 4 GLW -5%. ING -4%. WLP -3%. HES -3%. LYG -3%. EMR -3%. STD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • ILMN

    More on Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q3 profits +2.8% as revenue growth and record operating margins...

    More on Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q3 profits +2.8% as revenue growth and record operating margins offset higher material costs. But the stock is lower thsi morning after the company lowered its FY revenue growth outlook to between 24% and 26%, below estimates of 28%, due to a sluggish economy. Shares -9.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • CHKP

    Quick take on Juniper: While macro issues are having an impact, some of Juniper's problems...

    Quick take on Juniper: While macro issues are having an impact, some of Juniper's problems appear company-specific. Particularly in security hardware, where rivals Check Point (NASDAQ:CHKP) and Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) are faring better, and enterprise switching, where Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) aggressive pricing and low-end competition from the likes of Dell (DELL-OLD) and HP (NYSE:HPQ) are making things difficult.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • JNPR

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) is down 19.3% in premarket trading, as the company receives several...

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) is down 19.3% in premarket trading, as the company receives several downgrades following a weak Q2 report. During its earnings CC, Juniper provided a 2011 revenue growth forecast of 12-14%, below the 18% consensus, with the company blaming Japan's earthquake and weak carrier demand in addition to macro issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • LLTC

    More on Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ4 earnings were up 27%, due in large part to a lower...

    More on Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ4 earnings were up 27%, due in large part to a lower tax rate and a prior-year charge, but revenue fell and booking demand declined toward the end of the quarter. The company lowers FQ1 revenue guidance, now saying it expects an 8% decline, below expectations of a 2.1% increase. Shares -3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • LVLT

    Level 3 Communications (NASDAQ:LVLT): Q2 EPS of -$0.09 in-line. Revenue of $934.4M (+2.6% Y/Y)...

    Level 3 Communications (NASDAQ:LVLT): Q2 EPS of -$0.09 in-line. Revenue of $934.4M (+2.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • EXC

    Exelon (NYSE:EXC): Q2 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $4.59B (+4.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Exelon (NYSE:EXC): Q2 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $4.59B (+4.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.16B. Shares +2.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • MT

    More on ArcelorMittal's (NYSE:MT) earnings: Q2 performance was "underpinned by higher steel...

    More on ArcelorMittal's (NYSE:MT) earnings: Q2 performance was "underpinned by higher steel selling prices. Although [Q3] will experience some seasonal impact, we do not expect this to be as pronounced as last year, and overall the group's performance in [H2 2011] should compare favorably with [H2 2010]." Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (NYSE:BA): Q2 EPS of $1.25 beats by $0.27. Revenue of $16.5B (+6.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.07B....

    Boeing (NYSE:BA): Q2 EPS of $1.25 beats by $0.27. Revenue of $16.5B (+6.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.07B. Raises FY'11 EPS guidance to $3.90-4.10. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM
  • MCO

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO): Q2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $605.2M (+26.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO): Q2 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $605.2M (+26.7% Y/Y) beats by $55.9M. Raises FY'11 EPS guidance to $2.22-2.32. Shares +3.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT): Q2 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $25.13B (+24.7% Y/Y) beats...

    ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT): Q2 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $25.13B (+24.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.5B. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 AM
  • AET

    Aetna (NYSE:AET): Q2 EPS of $1.35 beats by $0.28. Revenue of $8.32B (-2.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Aetna (NYSE:AET): Q2 EPS of $1.35 beats by $0.28. Revenue of $8.32B (-2.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 AM
  • LYG

    Goldman downgrades the European banking sector to Neutral from Overweight, saying market doubts...

    Goldman downgrades the European banking sector to Neutral from Overweight, saying market doubts are beginning to creep back after some initial euphoria over Greece's second bailout. Domestic demand is likely to remain weak, hurting loan prospects, and concerns about capital raising remain high. LYG -2.8%, BCS -2.9%, ING -4.1%, STD -4.2%, DB -1.1%, UBS -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 AM
